snippet: American business leaders, in two separate advertising campaigns, are seeking to influence Washington as a political fight gets under on how to address the federal budget deficit.
abstract: Consortium of corporate executives known as Campaign to Fix the Debt will run $40 million advertising blitz to pressure Congress to quickly address fiscal cliff; group is attempting to frame issue as one of balancing budget, giving wary Congressional Republicans cover to vote for tax increases that could make them targets of their party's powerful fiscal conservatives.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and DAVID KOCIENIEWSKI

lead_paragraph: American business leaders, in two separate advertising campaigns, are seeking to influence Washington as a political fight gets under on how to address the federal budget deficit.

headline.seo: Business Chiefs Step Gingerly Into the Federal Budget Fight
headline.main: Business Chiefs Step Gingerly Into a Thorny Budget Fight
headline.print_headline: Business Chiefs Step Gingerly Into a Thorny Budget Fight
